issues.title: Cell border sometimes remains expanded after exiting edit mode (regression from v6.7.0 to v6.20.4)
issues.author: web-delivery
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-mpav2dlm?file=src%2Fdemo.tsx

Steps:
1. Click a cell to enter edit mode (the cell border expands).
2. Enter a value.
3. Click outside the grid to exit edit mode.
4. The cell border is expected to shrink back to the normal non-editing size.
5. However, in version 6.20.4, the border occasionally remains expanded as if still in edit mode.
6. Repeat several times. The issue occurs intermittently (approximately 1 out of 10 times).

### Current behavior

After leaving edit mode, the cell border sometimes does not return to its normal size and remains in the "editing" visual state. This happens intermittently (around 10% of the time).

### Expected behavior

When exiting edit mode, the cell border should always shrink back to the normal size. 
This behavior worked correctly in version 6.7.0.

### Context

The issue started after upgrading:
- "@mui/x-data-grid": "^6.7.0"  → "^6.20.4"
- "@mui/x-data-grid-pro": "^6.7.0" → "^6.20.4"

Impact: UI display issue only; data registration is not affected.
Possibly related to grids with row-addition enabled (not fully confirmed).

Support key (Order ID): 118470
Submitted by Tegara Corp. on behalf of our customer in Japan.

### Your environment

MUI X DataGrid Pro version affected: 6.20.4
Previously working version: 6.7.0


**Search keywords**: datagrid, datagrid pro, edit mode, cell border, border not shrinking, layout issue, intermittent, regression, v6.20.4, v6.7.0

**Order ID**: 118470

triage.suggestedAction: Investigate CSS regression in cell edit mode border between v6.7.0 and v6.20.4; paying customer with repro.
triage.summary: Regression: cell border intermittently remains in edit-mode visual state after exiting edit mode. Paying Pro customer with StackBlitz repro.

issues.title: RichTreeViewPro lazy loading spinners reset when any prop reference changes
issues.author: BrentFarese
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Render a `<RichTreeViewPro />` with a `dataSource` prop for lazy loading
2. Pass any prop as an inline object, function, or array (e.g. `dataSource={{ ... }}`, `isItemDisabled={item => ...}`, `selectedItems={Array.from(...)}`, `selectionPropagation={{ descendants: true, parents: false }}`)
3. Click to expand a folder that triggers lazy loading via `getTreeItems`

### Current behavior

The loading spinner either never appears or flashes for a single frame and vanishes immediately, even though the `getTreeItems` fetch takes multiple seconds.

### Expected behavior

The loading spinner should remain visible for the entire duration of the `getTreeItems` async call, as it did in `@mui/x-tree-view-pro@8.8.0`.

### Context

The root cause is in `RichTreeViewProStore.utils.js`. The `deriveStateFromParameters` function unconditionally resets `lazyLoadedItems` to `TREE_VIEW_LAZY_LOADED_ITEMS_INITIAL_STATE` on every call. This is called from `updateStateFromParameters`, which runs inside a `useIsoLayoutEffect` whenever the `parameters` memo changes. Since `parameters` depends on every prop passed to `RichTreeViewPro`, any prop that is not referentially stable causes `parameters` to be a new reference on every render, wiping the loading state.

**Search keywords**: tree view loading

**Order ID**: 116348

triage.suggestedAction: Fix deriveStateFromParameters to not reset lazyLoadedItems on every parameter change; premium customer with root cause analysis.
triage.summary: Premium customer bug: RichTreeViewPro lazy loading spinners get wiped on every render because deriveStateFromParameters unconditionally resets loading state. Regression from v8.8.0.

issues.title: [question] Disabling scrollbars on nested DataGrid in multi-level master-detail
issues.author: marpro200
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

Hi, I have a master-detail with tree layers. Each layer is again a full DataGrid with lots of columns. The default behaviour is, that each detail DataGrid has its own horizontal scrollbar. This is really annoying if you expand multiple details and their details.

Our requirement is: no detail has a scrollbar, master grid has a horizontal scrollbar that considers the width of its widest expanded detail.

**Search keywords**: datagrid master-detail scrollbars

**Order ID**: 112488

triage.suggestedAction: Provide guidance on syncing scrollbars across nested master-detail DataGrids; premium customer question.
triage.summary: Premium customer asks how to disable scrollbars on nested detail DataGrids and have the master grid's scrollbar account for detail widths in multi-level master-detail.

Allow labels to be a `React.ReactNode` so I can pass `<Skeleton />` to it and render a beautiful loading state that stays close to the real treeview. Or just a `loading` prop to show skeleton items.

**Search keywords**: RichTreeView loading skeleton

triage.summary: Feature request to support skeleton UI in tree view, either via ReactNode labels or a loading prop. Filed by MUI team member Jan Potoms.

issues.title: [question] How do you apply maintaining the expanded state of a group when the sort model changes for example?
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

The docs give an example of maintaining the group expansion state from a button click, but how to achieve the same when the sort model changes? Expanded state is lost after getRows returns new data.

**Search keywords**: datasource row grouping expanded state

**Order ID**: 45466

triage.suggestedAction: Provide guidance or docs example for preserving row group expansion state across sort model changes with server-side data; premium customer.
triage.summary: Premium customer asks how to maintain row group expansion state when the sort model changes with server-side data source. Current docs only show button-triggered persistence.

issues.title: [data grid] Row grouping with a datasource doesn't respect the order the rows are returned
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the live row grouping demo
2. Expand groups
3. Apply sort to a column
4. Sort is never respected

### Current behavior

When using a datasource with row grouping, the order of rows returned from getRows is never respected after first render. Cache invalidation doesn't help.

### Expected behavior

Changing the order of rows from getRows should be reflected in the grid.

**Search keywords**: datasource row grouping

**Order ID**: 45466

triage.suggestedAction: Investigate why datasource row grouping ignores row order from getRows after initial render; premium customer with repro on live demo.
triage.summary: Premium customer bug: server-side row grouping doesn't respect the order of rows returned by getRows after the first render. Sorting has no effect.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for reporting this! After investigating, the root cause is in how the datasource row grouping handles re-fetched data after sort changes. The current implementation deletes and re-inserts rows in two separate passes, but  always appends to the children array rather than respecting the order from . We need to implement an atomic row replacement that preserves server-side ordering. Tracked internally as X-4561.

investigation.approach: Traced the datasource row grouping pipeline: fetchRows → updateNestedRows → updateCacheWithNewRows → rowTreeCreation → updateRowTree → insertDataRowInTree → insertNodeInTree
painPoints: sortRows processor uses skipSorting() for datasource row grouping — correct since server handles sorting
When sort model changes and getRows returns rows in new order, fetchNodeChildren deletes then re-inserts rows
The delete-then-insert happens in two separate updateNestedRows calls, processed synchronously
insertNodeInTree always appends new nodes to parent.children array in insertion order
investigation.reasoning: The cache key (getKeyPremium) includes sortModel, so sort changes should cause cache miss and re-fetch. The issue is that after re-fetch, existing rows are deleted then re-inserted. However, the two updateNestedRows calls may not process atomically — the delete triggers a tree update, but the insert is a second pass. If the tree update from delete doesn't complete before insert, the rows may end up in the wrong order. Additionally, the cache invalidation may not clear all group-level caches properly.
investigation.suggestedFix: The delete+insert pattern in useGridDataSourceBasePro.ts (lines ~190-201) should be combined into a single atomic update. Instead of two separate updateNestedRows calls, implement a replaceNestedRows method that atomically replaces children while preserving the order from getRows response. The children array in the group node should be rebuilt from scratch based on the new row order.
investigation.conclusion: Root cause is non-atomic delete+re-insert of rows when sort model changes, combined with the tree insertion always appending to children array. The row order from getRows is lost because insertNodeInTree only appends, never reorders existing children.

issues.title: [charts] Warn users when the controlled tooltip does not match the trigger
issues.author: alexfauquette
issues.body:
If the user is controlling the state then it is an intentional behaviour. We could at least warn users if they update the state and it won't have any effect.

_Originally posted by @JCQuintas in https://github.com/mui/mui-x/pull/21351#discussion_r2822409299_

triage.suggestedAction: Add a dev warning when controlled tooltip state doesn't match the configured trigger; internal improvement from team discussion.
triage.summary: Internal feature request to add a development warning when a user controls chart tooltip state but it doesn't match the trigger configuration.

issues.title: DataGrid CSP Error: Emotion CacheProvider nonce is not used in inline styles
issues.author: visualjerk
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Clone reproduction repo, install, run dev. CSP errors appear because DataGrid's inline styles don't use the Emotion CacheProvider nonce.

### Workaround

Add the nonce directly to DataGrid: `<DataGrid nonce="N0NCE" />`

**Search keywords**: datagrid, csp, emotion, cacheprovider, inline styles, nonce

**Order ID**: 109756

triage.suggestedAction: Fix DataGrid to inherit nonce from Emotion CacheProvider for CSP compliance; Pro customer with reproduction repo.
triage.summary: Pro customer bug: DataGrid inline styles don't use the Emotion CacheProvider nonce, causing CSP violations. Workaround exists but shouldn't be necessary.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for the detailed repro! The DataGrid creates its own `<style>` tag for CSS variables and only uses the `nonce` prop, not the Emotion CacheProvider nonce. As you found, passing `<DataGrid nonce="N0NCE" />` works. We should fix this to auto-inherit from `CacheProvider` as a fallback, similar to how MUI core components handle it. Linear: X-4556.

investigation.approach: Searched all <style> tags and inline style usage in x-data-grid. Reviewed GridCSSVariablesContext which creates <style> tags with rootProps.nonce.
painPoints: DataGrid CSS variables context (context.tsx) creates <style> tag using rootProps.nonce
The nonce prop must be passed explicitly to DataGrid — it does NOT auto-inherit from Emotion CacheProvider
Only one <style> tag is created by the DataGrid (for CSS variables)
Inline style attributes on GridCell, GridRow, etc. are separate concern — CSP2 blocks these too without unsafe-inline
The default CSSVariablesContext has a fallback <style href="/unset" /> without nonce
investigation.reasoning: The DataGrid already supports a nonce prop and applies it to its CSS variables <style> tag. However, it does not read nonce from Emotion's CacheProvider. Users expect that wrapping the app in <CacheProvider value={cache}> (where cache has nonce set) should automatically propagate to all MUI components, but the DataGrid's internal <style> tag bypasses Emotion entirely. The fix would be to read the nonce from the Emotion cache context as a fallback when rootProps.nonce is not provided.
investigation.suggestedFix: In GridCSSVariablesContext, use useEmotionCache() (or equivalent) to read the Emotion cache's nonce as fallback: . This aligns with how MUI core components handle CSP. The inline style attributes are a separate issue — those require unsafe-inline in CSP and cannot use nonce.
investigation.conclusion: The DataGrid does not inherit nonce from Emotion CacheProvider. It needs explicit nonce prop. Fix: read Emotion cache nonce as fallback in GridCSSVariablesContext.

issues.title: ajv has ReDoS when using `$data` option
issues.author: damiangreen
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Add @mui/x-license ^8.26.0, run pnpm audit. Reports moderate vulnerability in ajv <8.18.0 via @mui/x-license>@mui/x-telemetry>conf>ajv (GHSA-2g4f-4pwh-qvx6).

### Workaround

pnpm override ajv to >=8.18.0

**Search keywords**: ajv has ReDoS when using `$data` option

triage.suggestedAction: Update ajv dependency in @mui/x-telemetry's conf package to >=8.18.0 to resolve GHSA-2g4f-4pwh-qvx6.
triage.summary: Security: moderate ReDoS vulnerability in ajv (<8.18.0) through @mui/x-license > @mui/x-telemetry > conf dependency chain. Affects all MUI X packages.

issues.title: [data grid] getRowId prop does not work with server-side tree data
issues.author: ahmedBilal5
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Server-side tree data grid fails when row id is provided through getRowId prop instead of from the data itself. Expanding a node and collapsing/re-expanding or triggering datasource recalculation throws error about missing id.

StackBlitz repro provided.

**Search keywords**: server-side tree data data-grid-pro

**Order ID**: 123695

triage.suggestedAction: Fix server-side tree data to properly use getRowId prop when updating rows; Pro customer with StackBlitz repro.
triage.summary: Pro customer bug: DataGridPro server-side tree data throws 'missing id' error when using getRowId prop instead of inline id property. Works fine with inline id.

issues.title: DataGridPro TreeData: "inside" Drop Not Triggered When Initial Data Contains No Child Nodes
issues.author: Abassion
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Open CodeSandbox repro. Drag a file into the 'src' folder. File is not reordered as a child inside the folder.

### Expected behavior

File should be reordered as a child inside the folder. Goal is an empty file system where users can create files/folders and reorder/nest them.

**Search keywords**: MUI DataGridPro treeData rowReordering inside drop not working

**Order ID**: 116191

triage.suggestedAction: Investigate tree data row reordering 'inside' drop target not working when initial data has no child nodes; Pro customer with CodeSandbox repro.
triage.summary: Pro customer bug: DataGridPro tree data row reordering doesn't allow 'inside' drop when the target folder initially has no children.
triage.suggestedComment: Thanks for reporting! After investigating, the "inside" drop operation requires the `setTreeDataPath` prop to update row paths when moving between parents. Without it, the operation fails silently. For your empty file system use case, please provide a `setTreeDataPath` callback that updates the row's tree data path. We should also improve the error handling to either (a) not show the drop indicator when `setTreeDataPath` is missing, or (b) surface the error clearly. Could you confirm if you're providing the `setTreeDataPath` prop?

investigation.approach: Traced the tree data row reorder pipeline: calculateDropPosition → isRowReorderValid → handleDragEnd → setRowPosition → treeDataReorderExecutor → DropOnLeafOperation
painPoints: calculateDropPosition correctly returns "inside" for middle 60% of row in treeData mode
DropOnLeafOperation.detectOperation handles inside drops on leaf nodes correctly
But DropOnLeafOperation.executeOperation calls setTreeDataPath!(newPath, originalRow) with non-null assertion
If setTreeDataPath prop is not provided, the warning fires but execution crashes at the non-null assertion
The error is caught silently by handleDragEnd try/catch, making the drop appear to do nothing
investigation.reasoning: The "src" folder with no children is modeled as a leaf node (type="leaf"). When dragging into it, DropOnLeafOperation is selected. The operation warns about missing setTreeDataPath but proceeds to call it with ! operator, causing a TypeError. The try/catch in handleDragEnd swallows the error silently.
investigation.suggestedFix: Two changes needed: (1) DropOnLeafOperation.detectOperation should return null if setTreeDataPath is not provided, with a clear console warning. (2) The "inside" drop indicator should not show if setTreeDataPath is missing, to give proper UX feedback. Additionally, consider whether empty folders should be modeled as groups (type="group" with children=[]) rather than leafs when treeData is enabled.
investigation.conclusion: Bug is caused by DropOnLeafOperation proceeding despite missing setTreeDataPath prop. The non-null assertion crashes silently. Users must provide setTreeDataPath for cross-parent and inside-drop operations to work with tree data reordering.

issues.title: [data grid] Group row at bottom?
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### Summary

Can the group row be placed at the bottom underneath expanded child rows? Common in financial applications where aggregate data for each group should be underneath. May only make sense for 1-level deep grids.

**Search keywords**: group grid

**Order ID**: 45466

triage.suggestedAction: Evaluate feasibility of rendering group rows below their children for financial use cases; premium customer request.
triage.summary: Premium customer requests ability to render group rows at the bottom of their expanded children, common in financial applications for aggregate display.

issues.title: Datagrid, saving a view with reorganize columns, filter and grouping does not work
issues.author: datalogyinc-cloud
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

In a data grid I apply filters, reorganize the columns and grouping. The resulting view I am saving with new name. When I try to load the saved view it looses all the saved filter, grouping and the column reorganization.

**Search keywords**: saving and reloading the view

triage.suggestedAction: Investigate view persistence not saving filters, column order, and grouping; needs reproduction details from reporter.
triage.summary: DataGrid saved views lose filters, column reorganization, and grouping when reloaded. No repro link or environment info provided.

issues.title: [DataGrid] Issue on upgrading to latest version
issues.author: Harshit-lawcus
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Upgrade from version 8.9.2 to latest. Grid breaks. Screenshot provided but no repro or error details.

React 18.3.1, Next 13.5.6, Node v20.17.0

**Search keywords**: Issue on upgrading to latest version

**Order ID**: 104650

triage.suggestedAction: Request minimal reproduction and specific error messages from premium customer; upgrade breakage from v8.9.2 to latest.

issues.title: [question] Breaking on upgrading version from 8.9.2 to latest version
issues.author: Harshit-lawcus

After upgrading from version 8.9.2 to the latest version, the MUI Data Grid component is no longer functioning correctly. Screenshot provided.

React 18.3.1, Next 13.5.6, Node v20.17.0

**Search keywords**: Issue on upgrading to latest version

issues.title: [pickers] using date-fns adapter with time format KK (Hour [0-11]) does not display properly
issues.author: rvspin
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

StackBlitz repro provided. Using date-fns adapter with time format KK (Hour [0-11]). Default time 00:32:00 shows as "KK:32:00 PM" instead of "00:32:00 PM". Changing hours in picker doesn't update the KK display.

**Search keywords**: time format KK, date-fns adapter

triage.suggestedAction: Fix date-fns adapter to properly handle KK (Hour 0-11) format token; StackBlitz repro available.
triage.summary: Pickers date-fns adapter doesn't properly handle the KK (Hour 0-11) time format token. Displays literal 'KK' instead of formatted hours.

issues.title: [Server Side Tree][data grid] Unable to sort the table when the number of rows in the page is less than the number of rows per page
issues.author: thomasmauriceco2ai
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Open ServerSideTreeData demo, set rows per page to 50, try to sort. Rows don't get sorted when actual row count is less than page size.

**Search keywords**: ServerSideTree Sorting Datagrid

**Order ID**: 102731

triage.suggestedAction: Fix server-side tree data sorting when row count is less than page size; premium customer with demo repro.
triage.summary: Premium customer bug: server-side tree data sorting fails when actual row count is less than the configured rows per page. Reproducible on official demo.

issues.title: [tree view] lazy-loaded tree: auto-expand child nodes
issues.author: caillou
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

Using lazy-loaded tree, when child items are returned with their own nested children, there's no way to auto-expand all sub-items. Tried controlled expandedItems and apiRef approaches without success.

StackBlitz repro provided.

**Search keywords**: tree lazy-load auto-expand

**Order ID**: 110649

triage.suggestedAction: Support auto-expanding nested children returned in lazy-loaded tree data; Pro customer with StackBlitz repro.
triage.summary: Pro customer requests ability to auto-expand child nodes when lazy-loaded tree returns nested subtrees. No current workaround works.

issues.title: [docs] MCP server mui-mcp does not support resource listing
issues.author: f1eeman
issues.body:
### Related page

https://mui.com/material-ui/getting-started/mcp/#vs-code-cursor-windsurf

### Issue description

When trying to use MUI X components with MUI MCP server in Windsurf v1.13.9, error: 'Failure listing resources: server mui-mcp does not support resources'. Docs don't address MCP server limitations.

**Search keywords**: MCP, mui-mcp, Failure listing resources

triage.suggestedAction: Update MCP server docs to mention resource listing limitations and troubleshooting for Windsurf.
triage.summary: Docs feedback: MUI MCP server doesn't support resource listing in Windsurf IDE. Documentation doesn't mention this limitation.

issues.title: [data grid] Screen reader over-reads DOM after rowReordering live region announcement
issues.author: rhysmitchell
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Open StackBlitz demo. Move a row using row action menu. Screen reader announces the move but then dictates the entire grid DOM.

### Expected behavior

Clear, concise screen reader announcements without reading entire DOM afterwards.

**Search keywords**: MUI, DataGridPro, rowReordering, live region, screen reader, accessibility, aria-live

triage.suggestedAction: Investigate live region implementation causing screen reader to read entire grid DOM after row reorder announcement.
triage.summary: Accessibility bug: after row reordering, the live region announcement triggers the screen reader to dictate the entire grid DOM, making the feature unusable for screen reader users.

issues.title: [data grid] Grouping with checkbox selection and server-side-data
issues.author: leonhardanthony
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

Open StackBlitz demo. Multiple issues with grouping + checkbox selection + server-side data:
1. Selecting a group then expanding it deselects both group and children
2. Selecting some children makes parent indeterminate; collapsing loses state
3. Also reproducible without server-side data using 'select all' checkbox

**Search keywords**: checkbox selection, grouping, server-side-data

**Order ID**: 118089

triage.suggestedAction: Fix checkbox selection state management with row grouping and server-side data; premium customer with 3 distinct selection bugs.
triage.summary: Premium customer reports 3 interrelated bugs: checkbox selection state is lost when expanding/collapsing groups with server-side data. Indeterminate state not preserved.
